quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: Don't beat around the bush, just tell me the truth.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: She told a joke to break the ice at the party.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.expression: Hit the nail on the head
quests.sampleAnswer: You hit the nail on the head with your analysis.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: I am feeling under the weather today so I will stay home.

quests.sampleAnswer: The test was a piece of cake. I finished in ten minutes.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.expression: Cost an arm and a leg

quests.sampleAnswer: I decided to bite the bullet and ask for a raise.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: She was burning the midnight oil to finish her thesis.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.expression: Let the cat out of the bag
quests.sampleAnswer: He let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: The project failed, so we are back to square one.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: Let us make sure we are on the same page before we proceed.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.expression: The ball is in your court
quests.meaning: It is your turn to act.
quests.sampleAnswer: I have made my offer. The ball is in your court now.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: Come on, spill the beans! What happened at the meeting?

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.sampleAnswer: He visits his hometown once in a blue moon.

quests.instruction: Use this expression in a sentence.
quests.meaning: Something good from a bad situation.
quests.sampleAnswer: Losing that job was a blessing in disguise.
